thread.title: Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond
thread.title_full: Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond
text:
Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond Sources tell Free Press that the Pistons' center will very likely remain with the team past Thursday's deadline Post to Facebook Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond Sources tell Free Press that the Pistons' center will very likely remain with the team past Thursday's deadline   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2lspne5   Join the Conversation   Detroit Pistons unlikely to trade center Andre Drummond Vince Ellis , Detroit Free Press 5:32 p.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 CLOSE x Share Free Press sports writers Shawn Windsor and Vince Ellis discuss what they've seen from Reggie Jackson and the Pistons heading into the All-Star break, and what to expect down the stretch Wednesday, Feb. 15, 2017. Video by Vince Ellis, DFP. Pistons center Andre Drummond looks to pass against the Jazz on Jan. 13, 2017. (Photo: Chris Nicoll, USA TODAY Sports) 8 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Multiple persons with firsthand knowledge of the Detroit Pistons organization have told the Free Press over the past 24 hours that center Andre Drummond will very likely remain with the team past Thursday’s 3 p.m. trade deadline. 
“We want to keep him,” one person texted to the Free Press. 
The rumor mill will keep churning . 
ESPN.com’s Marc Stein wrote on Twitter this afternoon that the Pistons aren’t turning away trade calls on Drummond. 
“Hearing more and more teams say today they believe Detroit will NOT discourage trade inquiries for center Andre Drummond this week,” he tweeted. 
But with less than 48 hours remaining before the deadline, two sources told the Free Press no deals are likely. 
A lot of the speculation swirling around Drummond – and point guard Reggie Jackson – is based on the league-wide perception that the Pistons have underperformed so they must be open to a move. 
Related: SI: Andre Drummond among 5 players who should be traded but won’t be 
But the Pistons (27-30) are one game off last season’s pace when they were considered an up-and-coming team. Their first game out of the NBA All-Star break comes Thursday night when the Charlotte Hornets visit the Palace (7:30, FSD). 
Drummond is in the first year of a five-year, $127-million maximum contract he signed last summer. That brings amazement that the Pistons could be considering a move after such a massive commitment. 
But one thing to remember about Drummond trade rumors – the center is tight with Pistons owner Tom Gores. 
Other trade rumors: The player drawing the most interest as the trade deadline approaches – Kentavious Caldwell-Pope. … Before cleaning house and turning over basketball operations to Magic Johnson , the Los Angeles Lakers expressed interest in Jackson. … Contradicting a report from over the weekend, a source told the Free Press the Pistons never engaged the Sacramento Kings on a deal for DeMarcus Cousins, who was traded to the New Orleans Pelicans .
